sentences.english: Confession is the first step to repentance.
Her darling boy was to come back to her repentant and tender-hearted.
sentences.chinese: 她的宝贝孩子即将怀着悔罪和体贴的心回到她的身边。

sentences.english: He never seems to have been touched with the slightest remorse for his crimes.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎从来没有丝毫悔罪之意。

sentences.english: The word also had a penitential meaning.
sentences.chinese: 这个字也有悔罪的意思。

sentences.english: Since he has been penitent , I don't think he will do that again.
sentences.chinese: 既然他已经悔罪了，我认为他不会再那样做了。

sentences.english: For three days the Pope kept him waiting, barefoot and in penitential garb.
sentences.chinese: 教皇让他穿着悔罪服，赤着脚在堡外等候了三天。

sentences.english: I don't think he will do that again.
sentences.chinese: 既然他已经悔罪了，我认为他不会再那样做了。

sentences.english: The sacrament of penance and the confession of sins are rather late innovations.
sentences.chinese: 悔罪的仪式跟原罪的告解是相当晚期才革新的。

sentences.english: And new pervert a reconciled maid.
sentences.chinese: 让一个悔罪的姑娘重新犯罪。

sentences.english: Offenders who confess to escaping being demanded tax arrears will get off.
sentences.chinese: 逃避追缴欠税款主动悔罪被从轻。

sentences.english: He disburdened by confessing his sins.
The seven trumpets are God's warning to humans to repent and change their ways.
sentences.chinese: 七枝号代表上帝给人的警告，要我们悔罪并改邪归正。

definition: to admit to a crime/to plead guilty
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to repent and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
